intro: Linociera battiscombei, commonly known as the Natal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Linociera battiscombei thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
